p: Results showed that all essential oils had interesting anti-inflammatory activities, the leaf samples displaying higher anti-inflammatory activities than the flower essential oil. The high anti-inflammatory activity of the LC (L) Jl2 sample is probably due to the high proportions of (E)-β-caryophyllene and α-humulene, which are particularly effective [ 72, 73]. However, it is also possible that some other compounds interact synergistically or antagonistically. The anti-inflammatory activity of L. camara extracts has previously been demonstrated in several studies [ 12, 74, 75, 76]. However, IC 50 values were lower than 17.75 µg/mL in the present study (IC 50 of L. camara essential oil from Peru was 81.5 µg/mL [ 7]), indicating that L. camara is a plant with anti-inflammatory properties in various forms, supporting the wide use of this plant in traditional medicine for its anti-rheumatism properties [ 5].
